name: insert-molang-file
description: This extension lets you use '.molang' files when working on larger scripts and then easily insert them as single-line string into any Minecraft Bedrock add-on file.

editor/context.when: editorLangId == javascript || editorLangId == json || editorLangId == jsonc

commandPalette.when: editorLangId == javascript || editorLangId == json || editorLangId == jsonc

molang-insert.typing.prefix.markdownDescription: Sepecifies prefix for a string to use before MoLang file name in such format: `{prefix}{fileName}.molang`, leave blank for no prefix to be required in the string. *Only applies when `#molang-insert.typing.enabled#` is set to `true`.*

molang-insert.typing.enabled.markdownDescription: If set to `true`, you can insert MoLang files by typing their name in specific context with optional prefix defined in `#molang-insert.typing.prefix#`. *Reload Visual Studio Code for changes to take effect.*

enumDescriptions: Sorts the files by their date modified.
Sorts the files by their name alphabetically.
molang-insert.fileSorting.description: Sets the order of files in the Insert MoLang File menu.
